intro: Neolloydia pilispina, commonly known as the narrowleaf neolloydia, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is a perennial herb native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Thailand and Malaysia. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are lanceolate and have a distinctive pungent odor, while the small white flowers bloom in clusters. Neolloydia pilispina is valued in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
